オプション1: Star Man and the others kept practicing, testing, and improving with the raft.

At first they could row with oars for only about an hour,
but after a month they could row for several hours with breaks.
They also tested how far they could go in an hour.

Their cruising speed was roughly 2 km/h,
and it turned out they couldn't make it unless wind and current were favorable.
That day, Star Man was loading the raft for departure.
When he finished loading, he looked back at the other two.
"Well then... I'm going to give it a try."
"...Yeah. Don't die."
None of the three were smiling.
A black vortex appeared, and the horned man emerged.
"Ah, uh, hello."
They all averted their gaze.
"You're having fun."
"Y-yes..."
"If you leave this island and re-enter, the contract will disappear."
"You mean if I leave once and come back, the contract will be gone?"

"That's not correct—it's not that the contract disappears.
The contract remains, but the procedures can no longer be carried out."
(By procedures, he means the collection of my life.)
"If you succeed in escaping this island, I'll void your contract."
"Well, just because. Losing one contract isn't much of a loss to me."
"Besides, it would be troublesome if you used magic in the outside world and became famous."
"Thank you."
"Thank you, Mr. Horns!"
Triangle Man said.
"Well then, I'll be taking my leave."
The horned man returned into the black vortex.
